title: Simple burglar alarm
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to create a simple burglar alarm

Select **EnviromentalMotion** to detect motion with your device's camera

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/EnviromentalMotion-Item.png)

this will be used to measure the intensity of movement of potential thieves.

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press Devices again, select **AudioPlayer** device to play audio from youtube on your smartphone

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/AudioPlayer-Item.png)

this will be used to play an alarm when a certain intensity of motion is detected by the camera.

Press on your smartphone **Add device via QR code**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Add-device-via-qr-code.png)
and scan the QR code. Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar

Move the **if** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)
and the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png)
components to the workspace

Move the **intensity** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/intensity.png)

and the **player**
![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/play-audio.png)
components to the workspace

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/alarm.png)
the idea is that the alarm will sound if the intensity of the captured motion is greater than the number you set.

To repeatedly verify the intensity of motion captured with the device, we will use the main loop component, which allows us to re-run the code after it has finished executing.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/Loops.png) on the sidebar.

Then, move to the workspace the
![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/main-loop-component.png)
component and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/main-loop.png)
